linkTarget.anchoringText: Reservoir-A Reservoir-A has been penetrated by two wells; the minimum amplitude map for this reservoir is shown in the Figure 1.

image-wrap.label: Figure 1
image-wrap.caption: Minimum amplitude map for Reservoir-A, 1P area of interest is shown by red polygon

formatted-caption.caption-text: Minimum amplitude map for Reservoir-A, 1P area of interest is shown by red polygon

linkTarget.anchoringText: Reservoir-B The Reservoir-B in Field-X has been penetrated by fourteen wells, displayed in the Minimum Amplitude map for the reservoir (Figure-2). The area of interest for SCRV estimation is shown by the red polygon (1P Polygon), primarily based on the following:

image-wrap.label: Figure 2
image-wrap.caption: Minimum amplitude map for Reservoir-B, 1P area of interest is shown by red polygon

formatted-caption.caption-text: Minimum amplitude map for Reservoir-B, 1P area of interest is shown by red polygon

linkTarget.anchoringText: Analysis The methodology is to extrapolate the pressure depth correlation till it intersects the bubble point pressure to estimate the possible GOC. The extrapolation is described in Figure-3. The resulting GOC range was shallower than the crest observed in polygon of interest indicating a high possibility of oil fill to the crest of the reservoir. Based on this conclusion, the 1P area was extended to the crest to be oil filled for the SCRV estimation.

image-wrap.label: Figure 3
image-wrap.caption: Analysis for Reservoir-A showing the possible GOC range

formatted-caption.caption-text: Analysis for Reservoir-A showing the possible GOC range

linkTarget.anchoringText: Refer to Figure 4 for the cartoon illustration of the above mentioned methodology.

image-wrap.label: Figure 4
image-wrap.caption: Cartoon illustration-Estimation of pressure depth equation using the uncertinaty range of OWC

formatted-caption.caption-text: Cartoon illustration-Estimation of pressure depth equation using the uncertinaty range of OWC
